name: Energy Policy and Environment
description: The course addresses: (1) physical, technological and economic aspects of energy and electricity systems and their associated environmental impacts; (2) current international, Canadian and Ontario energy policy; (3) technological, economic and political factors influencing policy which could significantly reduce environmental impacts of energy use.
prerequisites: Completion of 8.0 FCE including ENV221H1/ENV222H1; or permission of the Undergraduate Associate Director
